item.title: How can I use CoinSimple to issue invoices and send them via email?
item.description:
This guide explains how to issue your first CoinSimple invoice, in 2 steps. The process is quite simple but the steps are described here in great detail.

If you haven’t already done so, set up an account with CoinSimple. Detailed instructions on how to do that, can be found here.

1. Create an invoice

All you have to do is click on “Invoices” and then on “New Invoice”. At that point you need to enter or choose:

  • You client’s name
  • Your client’s email
  • The currency that you want to price your invoice in (all national currencies are supported)
  • The wallet or payment processor that you want to receive your funds to
  • The source of bitcoin price (Bitcoin Average, CoinDesk, Blockchain.info, Bitstamp, BitPay, Coinbase, GoCoin) or a set price
  • The name of your invoice items, their numbers and their unit price

You can also, optionally, choose a discount or to make your invoice recurring, on the same day of every month, or every a certain number of days. Recurring invoices will be sent perpetually, or for a certain number of times.

2. Save the invoice and select delivery options

At this point, you can send your invoice via email, review it, edit it, or delete it.

item.title: How can I set up an account with CoinSimple?
item.description:
This guide will explain the process for signing up with CoinSimple in 3 steps. The process is quite simple but the steps are described in great detail.

1. Sign Up for a CoinSimple account

Go to the CoinSimple Sign Up page. Enter your name, your email and select a password. After you read the CoinSimple Terms of Service and Privacy Policy, and check that you agree with them.

2. Set up a business

The app will automatically lead you to a page to set up a new business. (In order to create an invoice, you need to first create a business, that is why, the app will not let you move to any other part of the site, before you set up a business.) In the form that appears, enter the name of your business and its description. Both the name and description of your business appear in the invoices that you send to your customers, so choose them appropriately. Also, enter the currency that you use most commonly for your invoices (you can change that later and even for every invoice that you issue). Finally, enter the source of the bitcoin price that you will most commonly use for your invoices (again, you can change the source later, and for every invoice, if you like.) After you select whether you want to receive emails when you create a new invoice and when you get paid, you are done.

3. Connect your wallet or payment processor

The app will now lead you to a page to connect your wallet or your existing bitcoin processor account. (In order to get paid for your invoices, you will need to have a wallet where the funds will be directed – CoinSimple does not offer a wallet service. That is why, the app will not let you move to any other part of the site, if you don’t set up wallet.) These support pages explain how you can connect your Electrum, Armory, Trezor, or any bitcoin address. At this point you can add additional wallets and bitcoin payment processors to your business to give yourself more flexibility.

item.title: How can I use CoinSimple with WooCommerce?
item.description:
The CoinSimple WooCommerce plugin is an extension of the WooCommerce plugin for Wordpress, and allows e-commerce stores, running on Wordpress and WooCommerce, to accept bitcoin through CoinSimple.

Requirements

  1. Installed WooCommerce plugin on your Wordpress site. (Installation instructions can be found at www.woothemes.com/woocommerce).
  2. A Business ID and API key from CoinSimple.com. To find your information, go to your CoinSimple.com dashboard, select your business, and go to “Settings”. You will find your Business ID and API key under “Busines Information” and “API Credentials”.

Installation

Do not attempt to install this plugin through the WordPress Plugins dashboard. Use the following instructions, instead.

  1. Download a zip file of the plugin from this link.
  2. Log in to your WordPress site as administrator and click on “Plugins”->“Add New”->“Upload”->“Choose file” and select the zip file you downloaded. Click on “Install Now” followed by “Activate Plugin”.

At this point the plugin is installed and activated but it still needs to be enabled and configured.

Configuration

  1. Log into the WordPress dashboard and click “WooCommerce” and then “Settings”.
  1. In the screen that appears click on “Checkout” and then “CoinSimple”.
  1. Enter your CoinSimple.com business ID and API in the appropriate fields. Enter the URL of the page that your customers will be directed to after they make their payment.
  1. Click “Save changes”.

Use

  • When a buyer selects “Bitcoin” as their payment method, an invoice is generated at CoinSimple.
  • After the buyer pays, CoinSimple directs the buyer to the page that you selected in your Settings above.

Support

CoinSimple Support

  • If you are having a problem with this plugin, please use this Github issues page to report your problem.

WooCommerce Support

  • Homepage
  • Documentation
  • Support

Troubleshooting

  • This plugin requires PHP 5.4 or higher to function correctly. Contact your webhosting provider or server administrator if you are unsure which version is installed on your web server.
  • Ensure a valid SSL certificate is installed on your server. Also ensure your root CA cert is updated. If your CA cert is not current, you will see curl SSL verification errors.
  • Verify that your web server is not blocking POSTs from servers it may not recognize. Double check this on your firewall as well, if one is being used.
  • Check the system error log file (usually the web server error log) for any errors during CoinSimple payment attempts. If you contact CoinSimple support, they will ask to see the log file to help diagnose the problem.
  • If all else fails, send an email describing your issue in detail to . In your support request, please provide:
    • Wordpress version
    • WooCommerce version
    • PHP version
    • Other plugins installed
    • Configuration settings for the CoinSimple plugin
    • Screenshot of error messages, if any

item.title: How can I accept bitcoin directly to a bitcoin address using CoinSimple?
item.description:
You can use CoinSimple to accept bitcoins directly to any bitcoin address. This guide shows you how to find your bitcoin address in several wallets.

Example Wallets

  • Bitcoin Core
  • MultiBit
  • Hive
  • Green Address
  • Blockchain.info

Bitcoin Core

  1. Start Bitcoin Core and click on the “File” menu and the on “Receiving Addresses”.
  2. Select the address that you would like to use and click on the “Copy” button on the lower left.
  3. Return to the CoinSimple website and paste the bitcoin address.

Congratulations! You can now start receiving bitcoin directly to your Bitcoin Core wallet.

Back To Top

MultiBit

  1. Start MultiBit and click on the “Trade” menu and the on “Request Bitcoin”.
  2. On the right panel, you will see a Bitcoin address. Press on the button that is right next to the address to copy it to your clipboard.
  3. Return to the CoinSimple website and paste the bitcoin address.

Congratulations! You can now start receiving bitcoin directly to your MultiBit wallet.

Back To Top

Hive

  1. Start Hive and hover your mouse over the Bitcoin address of your choice.
  2. Click on the address and it will be copied to your clipboard.
  3. Return to the CoinSimple website and paste the bitcoin address.

Congratulations! You can now start receiving bitcoin directly to your Hive wallet.

Back To Top

Green Address

  1. Start Green Address and click on “Receive Money” link on the left.
  2. Click on “Show URI and address”.
  3. Select the bitcoin address that starts with either 1 or 3 and copy it.
  4. Return to the CoinSimple website and paste the bitcoin address.

Congratulations! You can now start receiving bitcoin directly to your Green Address wallet.

Back To Top

Blockchain.info

  1. Login to Blockchain.info.
  2. On the lower left of the screen, you will see a box that says “This Is Your Bitcoin Address”. Copy the address to your clipboard.
  3. Return to the CoinSimple website and paste the bitcoin address.

Congratulations! You can now start receiving bitcoin directly to your Blockchain.info wallet.

Back To Top

item.title: How can I accept bitcoin to my Trezor wallet with CoinSimple?
item.description:
In order to use CoinSimple to accept bitcoins directly to your Trezor hardware wallet, you need to find your master public key of your Trezor device. The first receiving address will be used by CoinSimple to verify that you have entered consistent information.

  1. Connect your Trezor hardware device to your computer and navigate to mytrezor.com. On the main screen, click on “Add Account” on the left.
MyTrezor.com Account Creation

Click on “Add Account” on the left

  1. “Account 3” is created by the software and it can be seen on the left as in the image below. In this demo, we will use “Account 3” for payment processing. Click on the “Advanced details” button.
MyTrezor.com Main Screen

Click on the “Advanced details” button.

  1. Find “Account 3” under the “Account public keys (XPUB)” section, and copy the long alphanumeric code that starts with “xpub” for “Account 3”.
Trezor account master public key

Copy the long alphanumeric code that starts with “xpub”

  1. Return to the CoinSimple website and paste the xpub key in the “Enter your account public key” field.
  2. Return to the MyTrezor.com website and click on your Account on the left of the screen. Click on the “Receive” tab and copy the address that is shown that starts with “1”.
Trezor first receiving address

Click on the “Export Watching-Only Copy” button on the right of the screen.

  1. Return to the CoinSimple website and paste the key in the “Enter the first address” field above.

Congratulations! You can now start receiving bitcoin directly with your Trezor hierarchical deterministic wallet.

item.title: How can I accept bitcoin directly to my Armory wallet using CoinSimple?
item.description:
In order to use CoinSimple to accept bitcoins directly to your Armory bitcoin wallet, you need to export your watching-only wallet file and the associated first receiving address from Armory. The first receiving address will be used by CoinSimple to verify that you have entered consistent information. This guide explains how to do that for version 0.92.3 of the Armory wallet.

If you experience problems with these instructions, please upgrade your wallet by visiting this link.

Follow these steps:

  1. Start Armory, click on your preferred wallet from “Available Wallets” and lick on the “Wallet Properties” button on the left.
  2. A new “Wallet Properties” window will appear. Click on the “Export Watching-Only Copy” button on the right of the screen.
Armory Wallet Properties

Click on the “Export Watching-Only Copy” button on the right of the screen.

  1. In the “Watch-Only Wallet Export” window that appears, click on the “Export Watching-Only Wallet File” in the middle of the window.
Armory Wallet Properties

Click on the “Export Watching-Only Wallet File” in the middle of the window.

  1. Save file with the “.watchonly.wallet” extension on your Desktop. Press “Done” in the “Watch-Only Wallet Export” window.
  2. Go to the CoinSimple website, navigate to “Settings”, “Wallets and Processors”, and click on “Armory”.
  3. In the form that appears, press the “Choose File” button and upload the “.watchonly.wallet” file.
  4. Return to Armory. In the “Addresses in Wallet” section of the “Wallet Properties” window, you will see a list of addresses. Right-click on the first address, and press “Copy to Clipboard”.
Armory Wallet Addresses

Right-click on the first address, and press “Copy to Clipboard”.

  1. Return to the Armory page on the CoinSimple website. Paste the copied the key in the “For verification, paste the first address of your wallet” field.
  2. Click “Submit”
  3. You will need to verify the addition of this Armory wallet. So, check your email for a message from CoinSimple and click on the relevant link.

Congratulations! You can now start receiving bitcoin directly with your Armory deterministic wallet.

item.title: How can I accept bitcoin directly to my Electrum wallet using CoinSimple?
item.description:
In order to use CoinSimple to accept bitcoins directly to your Electrum bitcoin wallet, you need to extract your master public key and first receiving address from Electrum. The first receiving address will be used by CoinSimple to verify that you have entered consistent information. This guide explains how to do that for version 1.9.8 of the Electrum wallet.

If you experience problems with these instructions, please upgrade your wallet by visiting this link.

Follow these steps:

  1. Start Electrum and click on the “Wallet” menu and then on “Master Public Key”.
Electrum Menu: Master Public Key

Click on the “Wallet” menu and then on “Master Public Key”

  1. A “Master Public Key” window will appear. Copy the long series of letters and numbers shown on the left and press “Close”.
Your Electrum master public key

Copy the long series of letters and numbers shown on the left and press “Close”

  1. Go to the CoinSimple website, navigate to “Settings”, “Wallets and Processors”, and click on “Electrum”. In the form that appears, paste the copied the key in the “Enter your Electrum master public key” field.
  2. Return to Electrum and click on the “Receive” tab.
  3. In the “Receiving” section of the window that opens, you will see a list of addresses. Right-click on the first address, and press “Copy to Clipboard”.
Your first Electrum receiving address

Right-click on the first address, and press “Copy to Clipboard”

  1. Return to the Electrum page on the CoinSimple website. Paste the copied the key in the “For verification, paste the first address of your wallet” field.
  2. Click “Submit”
  3. You will need to verify the addition of this Electrum wallet. So, check your email for a message from CoinSimple and click on the relevant link.

Congratulations! You can now start receiving bitcoin directly with your Electrum deterministic wallet.

item.title: Will CoinSimple integrate PayPal or Stripe payments?
item.description:
We at CoinSimple believe that the future of payments is decentralized and peer-to-peer. We also believe that the centralized payment processor space is well served, and increasingly crowded. Because of that we have decided to focus our limited resources on developing products for the cryptocurrency space.

What are your options if you are a merchant and want to provide both a decentralized solution (CoinSimple) and a centralized solution like PayPal or Stripe? There are several options but the one that we have found easiest to work with are a combination of Wordpress for your e-commerce store, WooCommerce for the centralized payments, and the CoinSimple WooCommerce plugin for the decentralized solutions. See a demo of such a set up, without the PayPal integration, here.
